projects.title: Public Safety Network at Queensland Police
projects.description:
Public Safety Network
The Public Safety Network (PSN) Project aims to implement a shared fixed data network
where the agencies will share common carriage, equipment and management infrastructure
for both their local and wide area network services.
Implementation of the PSN will provide a common network for the Departments of Police,
Emergency Services, Corrective Services and Justice and Attorney-General. The Queensland
Government has committed $103.9 million in output and $50.6 million in equity funding over
four years for the PSN to provide a more efficient and coordinated network with the
capability to connect people, sites, processes, systems and data.

profile_positions.company: ONYOURMARK ITIL Trainer txt +31653577287 or info@onyourmark.nl
profile_positions.description:
Mark Jan Drenth
Update 2018 Achievements

I went to South Africa in 2003 with my IT Networking and technical knowledge. In Johannesburg, I achieved corporate experience through ABSA Bank Distributed Services, and when I left South Africa 6 years later I worked as a certified IT Service Management consultant and Trainer.

Some of the accomplishments were training IT Staff in African locations, like Gabon, DRC, Cameroun, UAE, Kuwait (ISO20000) Zambia and others. Helping to better train African IT workers is, in my opinion, a contribution to the local economy and the building of skills in African countries.

In Mozambique, Inhambane  I did a course in deep-sea diving and completed an PADI advanced diving certification.

In Brisbane Australia, I landed a contract with LucidIT and completed the documentation for the Public Safety Network. The project documentation and deliverables were on time and on budget for the configuration, release and change management processes.
In the Netherlands Ministry of Economy (Dienst Regelingen) I supported the Business Relationship team to help integrate the new Relations ORACLE database with the current business processes, ie related department, debit and credit department etc, and realised the access to knowledge base for access and searchability of this information for further technical and functional support.
I am currently working with the Knowledge Academy and have achieved the ITIL v3 Practitioners Certification in 2017.
In my work as an ITIL v3 Foundations trainer I realise a high achievement rate for my students in completing the ITIL Foundation Exam.
Other achievements are in travel in Europe, were I frequently visit European cities like Dusseldorf, Munchen, Frankfurt, Barcelona, Zurich, Stockholm, Copenhagen, Amsterdam, and others. Currently,  I am engaged in training personnel in ITIL so they can function better in high demand and high availability IT Environments.
profile_positions.title: Mark Jan Drenth Update 2018 Achievements

Testimonial of a recent ITIL Delegate Marcus:
Hi Mark,
 
I’m very well thank you and I hope you are keeping well too?
 
I am happy to say that I passed the #ITIL Foundation exam, so thank you for delivering a great course – I very much enjoyed the experience.  I’ve signed up to learn more about the new ITIL Practitioner qualification from Axelos (which apparently has a more practical focus on implementation) and will continue to push on and pass the other exams.
profile_positions.title: IT Service Management Trainer - Coach - ICT Process Consultant

profile_positions.description:
I handle diversity well, I see myself as an excellent interface between a companies IT management policies and the cultural differences in IT personnel. ITIL is a great way to standardize the language that IT Specialists speak among each other. Your background being British, Indian, Bulgarian, Dutch, German, Polish or Nordic does not necessarily have to impact your day-to-day work in IT. ITIL brings these different cultural backgrounds together with an ITIL process implementation. This partly technical and partly social solution benefits not only the company but grows professionalism in IT groups and technical experts. I enjoy conveying the message of ITIL and bringing participants in the ITIL Foundation training to a higher level of process understanding.

Recent training activities:
Introduction PMP Project Management, Lausanne, Switzerland.
Business Negotiations Skills, Stockholm, Sweden.

Recent ITIL v3 BOOTCAMP:
Malmo, Sweden 7 - 8 April 2016
Munich, Germany 4 - 5 April 2016
Zurich, Switzerland 16 17 18 March 2016
Northampton, UK, 7 - 9 March 2016.
Stavanger, Norway, 1st March, Prezi, Presentations Training
Galway, Ireland, 15-16 February 2016.
Zurich, Switzerland, 1-2 February 2016. 
Krakow, Poland, 11-14 January 2016.
Milton Keynes, UK, 14-16 December 2015.
Basel, Switzerland, 7-8 December 2015. 
Ghent, Belgium, 19-20 November 2015. 
Cologne, Germany, September 2015. 
Geneva, Switzerland, 23-24 April 2015. 
Valleta, Malta, July 2015.

Further courses on offer:

ITIL process management, process flows, process description, narratives and notifications

profile_positions.company: Ministerie van Economische Zaken en Klimaat
profile_positions.description:
Relations Management
IBIS Identity Store
ILM Identity Lifecycle Management (MS Forefront)
Rebus/Connect 
Functional Application Management
Application Knowledge Management

Knowledge sharing, training & coaching

The main functions of  functional (application)  management

Essential tasks Functional Manager:
o The identification of needs and demand within the user organization
o Translating this demand solutions through specification or alter  the information.
o however not every need leads to a solution supply information vd
o Not every interpretation leads to an ICT task.
o Orders to the ICT supplier (DICTU) and manage, monitor and evaluate the implementation vd implementation (delivery or supply) of these
o Sometimes needs not be converted to a solution
o Sometimes needs delayed fullfilment
o Sometimes needs only partially filled. (Lower level of ambition)

Responsibilities of Information Management:
o Following policies of the organization (policy model)
o Translation of business needs to supply information
o Describe how information provision should look like and illustrates  the relationships between business processes and supporting information technology solutions.
o Securing quality of services and applications (application architecture)
o Functional management makes demands on the applications

profile_positions.description:
Het Hof van Wouw is een hofje voor bewoners met een centrale tuin.

In het centrum van Den Haag ligt aan de westzijde van de Lange Beestenmarkt (nummer 49 t/m 85) de Hof Van Wouw. Dit hofje is in 1647 gesticht door Cornelia van Wouw met als doel de huisvesting van alleenstaande vrouwen. Hiertoe beschikt de Hof Van Wouw over een aantal huisjes, geschikt voor eenpersoonshuishoudens. Tot op heden worden de bewoonsters nog gekozen aan de hand van de regels uit het testament van Cornelia van Wouw.

volunteer_experiences.description:
Driving disabled and people with a mobility impairment to their destination.

Mobility impairment refers to the inability of a person to use one or more of his/her extremities, or a lack of strength to walk, grasp, or lift objects. The use of a wheelchair, crutches, or a walker may be utilized to aid in mobility.
